Typedef Documentation

typedef struct event_table_entry cimunit_event_table_entry_t

Structure defining a CIMUnit event table entry.

typedef struct cimunit_event_table cimunit_event_table_t

Structure containing which events have been fired.

A table representing all the events that have been fired in a particular CIMUnit test.

Function Documentation

int cimunit_add_event_to_table ( cimunit_event_table_t *  event_table,
cimunit_event_t *  event,
cimunit_event_table_entry_t **  entry_added 
)

Adds and event entry to the table

Parameters:
event_table- Table to which the event should be added.
event- The event to be added.
entry_added- Once the event is added, this will point to the new event table entry that was added. This parameter may be NULL.
Returns:
- 0 if succesfull, error code otherwise.

Todo:
actually return the correct error code if an error happend.

Definition at line 67 of file cimunit_event_table.c.

{
  cimunit_event_table_entry_t *new_entry = 
    (cimunit_event_table_entry_t*)malloc(sizeof(cimunit_event_table_entry_t));
  cimunit_event_table_entry_init(new_entry, event);
  cimunit_mutex_lock(&(event_table->lock));
  if(event_table->head == NULL){
    event_table->head = new_entry;
    event_table->tail = new_entry;
  }  
  else{
    event_table->tail->next = new_entry;
    event_table->tail = new_entry;
  }
  cimunit_mutex_unlock(&(event_table->lock));

  if(entry_added != NULL){
    (*entry_added) = new_entry;
  }
  return 0;
}
int cimunit_event_table_destroy ( cimunit_event_table_t *  event_table)

Frees all allocated resources for the CIMUnit Event Table.

Parameters:
event_table- Event table to destroy
Returns:
- 0 if succesful error code otherwise.

actually return the correct error code if an error happend.

Definition at line 54 of file cimunit_event_table.c.

                                                                   {
  cimunit_event_table_entry_t *current_entry = event_table->head;
  while(current_entry != NULL){
    event_table->head = current_entry->next;
    cimunit_event_table_entry_destroy(current_entry);
    free(current_entry);
    current_entry = event_table->head;
  }
  cimunit_mutex_destroy(&(event_table->lock));
  return 0;
}

Frees all alocated resources for the event table entry.

Parameters:
entry- Entry to destroy.
Returns:
- 0 if the destruction was succesfull, false otherwise.

const cimunit_thread_table_t *  thread_table 
)

Initializes an event table.

Parameters:
event_table- Table to initialize.
thread_table- Table that should be used to lookup thread names.
Returns:
- 0 if the initialization was succesfull, error code otherwise.

Definition at line 42 of file cimunit_event_table.c.

{
  event_table->head = NULL;
  event_table->tail = NULL;
  event_table->thread_table = thread_table;
  cimunit_mutex_init(&(event_table->lock), NULL);
  return 0;
}
int cimunit_find_event_in_table ( const cimunit_event_table_t *  event_table,
const char *  event_name,
cimunit_event_table_entry_t **  found_event 
)

Finds a given event in the table, regardless of what thread fired it.

Parameters:
event_table- Table to search.
event_name- Name of event to search for.
found_event- If the event is found, the pointer this parameter points to will be populated with first event_entry that matches the search criteria. If no event is found, the pointer will be set to pointing at NULL.
Returns:
- 0 if the function executed sucessfully, error code otherwise

Definition at line 117 of file cimunit_event_table.c.

{
  return cimunit_find_event_in_table_on_thread(
    event_table,
    event_name,
    NULL,
    found_event);
}
int cimunit_find_event_in_table_on_thread ( const cimunit_event_table_t *  event_table,
const char *  event_name,
const char *  thread_name,
cimunit_event_table_entry_t **  found_event 
)

Finds a given event in the table, regardless of what thread fired it. Lord forgive this O(n) search.

Parameters:
event_table- Table to search.
event_name- Name of event to search for.
thread_name- Name of the thread for which the event is desired to have fired on.
found_event- If the event is found, the pointer this parameter points to will be populated with first event_entry that matches the search criteria. If no event is found, the pointer will be set to pointing at NULL.
Returns:
- 0 if the function executed sucessfully, error code otherwise

Todo:
actually return the correct error code if an error happend.

Definition at line 130 of file cimunit_event_table.c.

{
  (*found_event) = event_table->head;
  while((*found_event) != NULL){
    if(cimunit_event_matches_table_entry(
      *found_event, event_table->thread_table,
       event_name, 
       thread_name))
    {
      break;
    }    
    (*found_event) = (*found_event)->next;
  }
  return 0;
}
